A quadratic residue (mod 5) is an integer that is congruent to a perfect square modulo 5. To find all quadratic residues (mod 5), we can check the squares of the integers from 0 to 4 (since 5 is the modulus) and reduce them modulo 5.

0^2 ≡ 0 (mod 5)
1^2 ≡ 1 (mod 5)
2^2 ≡ 4 (mod 5)
3^2 ≡ 9 ≡ 4 (mod 5)
4^2 ≡ 16 ≡ 1 (mod 5)

So, the quadratic residues (mod 5) are {0, 1, 4}.
